text: This Postman collection provides comprehensive testing coverage for the Photo Finish™ LIVE PFL Pro API. The collection includes authentication setup, all available endpoints, example requests, and testing scenarios for developers integrating with the PFL Pro API.
Create a new account or log in with existing credentials
Navigate to My Stable → Settings → API at https://photofinish.live/mystable/settings/api
Subscribe to the PFL Pro paid subscription through the web interface
Note: PFL Pro subscription is only available through the web application - it cannot be done via API
Once subscribed, you'll see options to generate API credentials on the API settings page
Generate API Key: Creates the key for request routing
Generate Access Token: Creates a secure access token for request authentication
Important: You'll need both credentials - Both the API Key and the Access Token go in the header of all requests to authenticate the request.
Active PFL Pro Subscription: Required for all API access
Whitelisted Account: Production environments may require account whitelisting
Valid User Account: Registered account on https://photofinish.live
Test Data: Valid horse IDs, race IDs, and stable IDs for testing
Create a new environment in Postman with the following variables:
The PFL Pro API uses a JWT token authentication system:
All PFL Pro API requests require:

x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN
Content-Type: application/json

x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN
Content-Type: application/json
Plus apiSecret in request body for write operations.
Set Authorization:{{accessToken}} andx-api-key: {{apiKey}} in your header requests

GET {{baseUrl}}/pfl-pro/race-api/recommended/YOUR_TEST_HORSE
Headers:
  x-api-key: {{api-key}}
  Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN
  Content-Type: application/json

GET {{baseUrl}}/pfl-pro/race-api/recommended/YOUR_TEST_HORSE
Headers:
  x-api-key: {{api-key}}
  Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN
  Content-Type: application/json
Description: Get recommended races for a specific horse

GET {{baseUrl}}/pfl-pro/race-api/claiming/available
Headers:
  x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY
  Authorization: Bearer {{access-otken}}
  Content-Type: application/json

GET {{baseUrl}}/pfl-pro/race-api/claiming/available
Headers:
  x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY
  Authorization: Bearer {{access-otken}}
  Content-Type: application/json
Description: Get horses available for claiming

POST {{baseUrl}}/pfl-pro/race-api/PREFFERED_RACE_FROM_TEST_HORSE/join
Headers:
  x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY
  Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN
  Content-Type: application/json
Body:
{
  "horseId": "YOUR_TEST_HORSE"
}

POST {{baseUrl}}/pfl-pro/race-api/PREFFERED_RACE_FROM_TEST_HORSE/join
Headers:
  x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY
  Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN
  Content-Type: application/json
Body:
{
  "horseId": "YOUR_TEST_HORSE"
}
Description: Enter a horse in a specific race

GET {{baseUrl}}/pfl-pro/horse-api/YOUR_TEST_HORSE
Headers:
  x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY
  Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN
  Content-Type: application/json

GET {{baseUrl}}/pfl-pro/horse-api/YOUR_TEST_HORSE
Headers:
  x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY
  Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN
  Content-Type: application/json
Description: Get detailed information about a specific horse

GET {{baseUrl}}/pfl-pro/horse-api/stable/{{stableId}}
Headers:
  x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY
  Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN
  Content-Type: application/json

GET {{baseUrl}}/pfl-pro/horse-api/stable/{{stableId}}
Headers:
  x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY
  Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN
  Content-Type: application/json
Description: Get all horses owned by a specific stabe**:**

POST {{baseUrl}}/pfl-pro/marketplace-api/for-sale
Headers:
  x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY
  Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN
  Content-Type: application/json
Body:
{
  Build a HorseQueryParameters filter
}

POST {{baseUrl}}/pfl-pro/marketplace-api/for-sale
Headers:
  x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY
  Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN
  Content-Type: application/json
Body:
{
  Build a HorseQueryParameters filter
}
Description: Search for horses currently for sale

POST {{baseUrl}}/pfl-pro/marketplace-api/stud-listings
Headers:
  x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY
  Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN
  Content-Type: application/json
Body:
{
Build a HorseQueryParameter filter
}

POST {{baseUrl}}/pfl-pro/marketplace-api/stud-listings
Headers:
  x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY
  Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN
  Content-Type: application/json
Body:
{
Build a HorseQueryParameter filter
}
x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY - Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN - Content-Type: application/json
Use environment variables for sensitive data
Implement proper error handling in your applications
Respect rate limits and implement exponential backoff
Store API secrets and access tokens securely - never commit to version control or share with others
Use HTTPS only for all API communications
Monitor API usage to detect anomalies

Rate Limits: Contact support for current rate limit information
Support: Technical support available through official channels
Subscribe to PFL Pro at API Settings
Generate API Key via through stable settings -> api
Generate Access Token via through stable settings -> api
Obtain access token (Bearer token for authentication)
Set up Postman environment with apiKey, accessToken variables
Import collection with Bearer token authentication
Configure collection to use API Key header (x-api-key)

The Horse Query Parameters are used to provide comprehensive filtering, sorting, and pagination capabilities for horse data queries. This documentation covers all available parameters, their acceptable values, and provides practical examples for building effective queries.
Example 1: Find Retired Mares for Breeding
Explanation: Finds female horses (mares) owned by the user that are retired, not pregnant, and includes any that might be listed on marketplace. Results are sorted by age in ascending order.

Explanation: Finds male horses (stallions) available for breeding on the marketplace, that have breeding slots remaining, are retired, have a benchmark rating of at least 70, sorted by stud fee (ascending).

Explanation: Finds racing horses that are rested (not tired), have A or S grades, are not injured, have high benchmark ratings, prefer dirt surfaces, sorted by benchmark rating (descending) for the current season.
Example 4: Marketplace Horses by Price Range
Finds horses for sale between 10,000 and 50,000 Derby, with B or A grades, that are either racing or retired, sorted by price (ascending).
Finds rare bloodline horses that are retired with excellent start and speed attributes (A and S grades), sorted by total stars (descending).
Example 6: Complex Breeding Query with Exclusions

Finds stallions on breeding marketplace that won't create inbreeding with the selected mare, have at least 2 breeding slots remaining, excellent heart and temper attributes (A and S grades), sorted by breeds remaining (descending).
Attribute filters (startAttribute, speedAttribute, etc.) can only be used with retired (lifeStatus: [3]) or dead (lifeStatus: [4]) horses
The system will automatically restrict lifeStatus if attribute filters are used
isOnMarketplace and ownerPf2Id are mutually exclusive unless includeMarketplaceListingsForOwner is true
myListings: true automatically sets the seller to the requesting user
selectedMareId automatically excludes bloodlines that would cause inbreeding unless includeInBreeds: true
Breeding-related filters apply primarily to male horses (stallions)
Use limit to control response size (recommended: 25-100)
Complex attribute combinations may require longer processing time
Cursor-based pagination is recommended for large result sets
All grade-related parameters use integer values from the Grades enum (0-20)
Common grades: D=1, C=4, B=7, A=10, S=13
Use integer arrays like [7, 10, 13] for B, A, and S grades
Retrieves details of a specific horse by its ID
Retrieves details of a specific horse by its ID
Gets horses in a stable by its ID
Query Horses - takes HorseQueryParams in the body of the request
Query Horses - takes HorseQueryParams in the body of the request

curl --location --request GET 'https://api.photofinish.live/pfl-pro/horse-api/query' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--header 'x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN' \
--data '{
    "ownerPf2Id": "a311085a-ee6e-41ff-adbb-f34bb6b89653",
    "limit": 25,
    "includeMarketplaceListingsForOwner": true,
    "sortParameters": {
        "criteria": 0,
        "order": 0
    },
    "cursor": null
}'

curl --location --request GET 'https://api.photofinish.live/pfl-pro/horse-api/query' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--header 'x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN' \
--data '{
    "ownerPf2Id": "a311085a-ee6e-41ff-adbb-f34bb6b89653",
    "limit": 25,
    "includeMarketplaceListingsForOwner": true,
    "sortParameters": {
        "criteria": 0,
        "order": 0
    },
    "cursor": null
}'
Renames the horse from the horse ID in the url and the name in the request body
Renames the horse from the horse ID in the url and the name in the request body
